perturbation.original_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as a non-exclusive project sales lead finder for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek will use its best efforts to provide the following services to COMPANY.
perturbation.changed_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as the exclusive project sales lead finder for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek may, at its discretion, provide the following services to COMPANY.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'non-exclusive' to 'exclusive' and 'will use its best efforts' to 'may, at its discretion' creates a contradiction. Section 1(a) now implies Bravatek is the only lead finder, but Section 2(a) requires COMPANY to list Bravatek as a 'non-exclusive alliance partner,' leading to confusion over the exclusivity of the agreement. Additionally, the term Bravatek's effort is now optional which contradict the term of diligently perform their duties.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Duties of COMPANY COMPANY agrees to use its best efforts to promote and support project lead finding and after-sales support of Bravatek by: a. Listing Bravatek in all appropriate sales and marketing materials as a non-exclusive alliance partner (with focus of government customers) b. Provide timely responses to both technical and administrative questions posed by Bravatek. c. Promote Bravatek's product and service offerings whenever possible. d. Aid Bravatek in the writing of any technical/marketing/sales documents when requested and participate in mutually-agreed upon sales calls. e. Provide Bravatek with co-branded marketing material that can be emailed or handed to prospective clients.

perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek, Bravatek may receive a discretionary payment, the amount of which will be solely determined by COMPANY based on factors including but not limited to project revenue, sales margin, and perceived effort by Bravatek. Payment terms will be determined on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stipulates a clear compensation structure (10-20% lead-finder fee, payable NET 30). The modified clause introduces ambiguity by making payment discretionary and removing specific percentage guidelines. This contradicts Section 4, which creates uncertainty and a potential dispute over Bravatek's compensation, considering it was written to be mutually discussed, but not it isn't. This affect the payment due to services already render.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek, Bravatek may receive a discretionary payment, the amount of which will be solely determined by COMPANY based on factors including but not limited to project revenue, sales margin, and perceived effort by Bravatek. Payment terms will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given ninety (90) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement is indefinite from the date hereof, and will be reviewed every twelve (12) months. Either party may suggest modifications to the agreement during these reviews, but the Agreement will continue in effect unless mutually terminated. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'twelve (12) months' to 'indefinite' and modifying the renewal terms creates a contradiction. The original text had an automatic renewal with a 90-day notice requirement, while the changed text makes the agreement indefinite, only reviewed annually. The section still states “This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice.”, this creates contradiction with the new 30 days writting notice, leading to disputes over the contract's duration and termination conditions.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Term The term of this Agreement is indefinite from the date hereof, and will be reviewed every twelve (12) months. Either party may suggest modifications to the agreement during these reviews, but the Agreement will continue in effect unless mutually terminated. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice. 3 8) Notices Any notices required under this Agreement shall be delivered to: Bravatek Technologies, Inc. 2028 E. Ben White Blvd., Unit #240-2835 Austin, Texas 78741 Sibannac, Inc. 2122 E Highland Avenue, STE 425 Phoenix, AZ 85016
